output: You mean now? But I’m working at the shop.
Oh, I’m okay, I guess. How about you?

instruction: That was good. This chestnut mochi is uncommonly delicious.
output: Okay, well we’ve started making some chestnut mochi here…

instruction: Yes, ma’am, it is just as you say!
output: With Mister? Oh, you’re talking about Dera!
So what’s the deal? What business do you have with Dera?
This is a house for Dera?

instruction: Is this a tribute? Yes, I think it is a tribute! And I don’t entirely mind.
To possess such skill at such a tender age is commendable.
Maybe I did put a little extra effort into the project.
I saw him eat two chestnut mochi earlier today.
output: Well, Dera does like to eat our mochi, and he enjoys our dumplings, too!
But you guys, that can’t be the only way for him to lose weight, can it?
We just put Dera on a diet, and it’s for his own good.
It’s never a good idea for anyone to get too fat.

instruction: Dera’s taken advantage of everyone’s generosity.

output: But I guess his weight does affect your ability to tell fortunes, doesn’t it? So even though I do feel a bit guilty, we need to watch him pretty carefully to make sure he sticks to his diet plan, and he needs to get plenty of exercise, too.
This is supposed to be for Dera’s own good, you know!

instruction: You’re right, Dad. Being hungry is miserable.

output: Mmm… We’re sticking to the plan. You cannot give him food in secret, Grandpa. If you give him any food, I’m gonna have to do something.
Grandpa and Dad are gonna be a big problem.
Okay, then. I’ll take Dera to school with me so I can watch him very carefully.

instruction: Well, your intentions are perfectly obvious to me.

output: Oh, really? I never would’ve guessed! I’m so happy that you like it, Choi!

instruction: Mm-hmm. It’s a good idea to have everyone dress the same way. It’s as if they all get along.
output: Hahaha! I can’t say I’ve ever heard that before!

instruction: But there is one small problem. We don’t have any spare uniforms here.
output: Huh? Oh, I forgot about that. What should we do?
We’re on our way down now!

instruction: Does this really look all right on me?
I hope it doesn’t smell like mothballs. It’s been sitting in a drawer for a while and might need freshening up.

output: Think of the house that Kanna made for you and do your best!
Here’s some slippers! Choi, you can wear these.
Our first class of the day is going to be social studies, so we’ll be with Midori for that.

instruction: But I see that you’re lining up your desk to study alongside Tamako and the others. I get the feeling you’re a very smart girl.
I’m really starting to wonder if you’re thinking that maybe I’m…
output: So Choi, do you think that Kanna is younger than the rest of us and skipped some grades or something?

instruction: But my behavior was truly discourteous…

output: The uniform means that we’re all friends, right?
The acting leader? Huh? What’s that?

instruction: Fufu! Just part of her evil plan for world domination.

output: Dera, are you going to be okay?
Hey, Choi, since you were raised in the south, Japan in autumn must seem pretty cold to you.
I guess this is your hatsu-aki then!
It means it’s your first autumn!

instruction: Ahh… If it’s all the same, I’d prefer to wear this uniform.
output: Say what? A uniform’s fine, but style is a completely different matter.

instruction: No, that won’t do at all. Personally, I’d like to see her in a white lolita-style outfit.
output: I bet she’ll look super cute, no matter what she decides to wear!

instruction: Who the heck are you? Are you customers?
output: Uh, yes! How are you doing today?

instruction: Hmm? Are you sweating in that?
output: Maybe it’s because they wear lightweight clothes back home.
What do you think of this one?
That one really suits you, Choi!

instruction: What’s the deal, young ladies? Have you not prepared an outfit for yours truly?
Mister, you’re handsome enough just the way you are.

output: Good job, Midori! You have such a good eye!

instruction: So, did you guys buy any good stuff today?
output: Mmm… Well, I didn’t find anything I wanted to buy.

instruction: Tributes, aren’t they? Tributes to yours truly.
Go on, Choi. Go ahead and open it.
